Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with rosette in added white outline and added red centres above two faded white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bull (rump with patterned decoration and red patches and part of tail remaining) to right; part of pendant triangle and elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the pattern decoration on the bull's rump, see New York Metropolitan Museum of Art 55.71.8 from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0443) (phase 2)
